attributes.action: refuse permission for the Olympic Flame to be carried in the UK in 2008 until China can show to an independant UN appointed committee that it has complied with human rights undertakings given to the Olympic Committee with particular consideration of the indigenous tibettan people.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is of great concern that we as a country are participating in the 2008 Olympic Games which aggrandises and rewards China greatly.

The rule of China in Tibet appears to be inhuman, prejudiced against the native tibettan people, economically motivated and plain and simply outside normal decency.

There should be every diplomatic effort made to exert pressure on the Chinese government at all levels to grant plain decent human rights to all Tibettans. The matter of Tibettan independance/liberation should also be raised
